org.apache.zab.transport

Class Transport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.zab.transport.Transport
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyTransport, NettyTransport

    public abstract class Transport
extends Object
    Abstract transport class. Used for communication between different Zab instances. It will handle connections to different peers underneath. When the transport is disconnected from a destination, it calls onDisconnected() callback, and it stops sending/receiving messages to/from the destination. Any subsequent send() call to the destination will simply be ignored. To tell the transport to reconnect to the destination, the caller needs to call clear() method. The purpose of the clear() method is for the caller to explicitly acknowledge the onDisconnected event.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public abstract void send(String destination,
        ByteBuffer message)
        Sends a message to a specific server. The channel delivers the message in FIFO order. Transport establishes a connection to the destination implicitly the first time this method is called with a given destination.
        Parameters:
        destination - the id of the message destination
        message - the message to be sent

      • clear

        public abstract void clear(String destination)
        Clears the connection to the destination. If there is no connection to the destination, this method does nothing. This method clears any pending outgoing messages. Transport reestablishes the connection on the next send(). Note that Receiver.onDisconnected() callback will not be invoked when the caller clears the connection using this method.
        Parameters:
        destination - the id of the destination

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(Iterator<String> peers,
             ByteBuffer message)
        Broadcasts a message to a set of peers.
        Parameters:
        peers - the set of destination peers.
        message - the message to be broadcasted.

      • shutdown

        public abstract void shutdown()
                       throws InterruptedException
        Shutdown the transport.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if it's interrupted.
